alert.note: Alert for Broome; Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 10:03AM EDT until May 03 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Susquehanna River At Vestal affecting Tioga and Broome Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River At Vestal. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flood stage. The river overflows banks and lowland flooding begins within the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EDT Tuesday was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 12.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Susquehanna River Vestal 18.0 18.7 Tue 9 am EDT 15.7 14.2 12.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
